project_name: Development on Downtown Parking Plazas 1, 2 and/or 3
street_address: Parking Plazas 1, 2, and 3, Downtown Menlo Park
project_description: Project to develop housing, including affordable units and parking, on Downtown Parking Plazas 1, 2, and 3; includes RFQ review and direction to issue RFP for development teams.
Approval of alternatives to Below Market Rate Housing Guidelines and authorization of $3.6 million funding for land acquisition for a proposed affordable housing development.

Municipal initiative to explore local building code options and program enhancements to encourage building electrification for climate goals and energy efficiency, including specific local amendments.

project_name: San Mateo County Transportation Authority Shuttle Program Application
project_description: Resolution supporting the City's application for the San Mateo County Transportation Authority Shuttle Program funding for fiscal years 2025-26 and 2026-27.
Study session to consider needs analysis and potential strategies to enhance enrollment and financial sustainability at City-run preschool facilities.
Review and discussion of the Santa Cruz Avenue closure, including considering its repeal and future plans, and providing direction on public plaza design and improvements.

project_name: San Francisquito Creek Joint Powers Authority (SFCJPA) Flood Protection Project (SAFER Bay)
project_description: Project for flood protection and ecosystem/recreation bay improvements, including discussions on funding sources and implementation agreements.
Ordinance amending municipal code Title 11 to establish parking restrictions for oversized vehicles on city streets, with discussions on implementation and enforcement.
Resolution adopted to approve additional appropriations and amendments to the fiscal year 2024-25 adopted operating and capital budget.

project_name: Housing Element Site Selection Criteria Review
project_description: Study session initiated by Councilmember Schmidt to review and discuss site selection criteria and previous evaluation of City-owned properties for the 2023-2031 Housing Element.
Pilot program authorizing a stipend for Planning Commissioners, with direction provided on continuation or discontinuation.
Appeal hearing concerning the Planning Commission's approval of a use permit, architectural control, and Below Market Rate agreement for an 88-unit affordable housing development.
Annual workshop to establish City Council priorities for the upcoming fiscal year, covering topics such as housing, climate action, and downtown development.

project_name: Belle Haven Community Campus Senior Services
project_description: Discussions and public comments regarding the need for additional space, improved accessibility, and enhanced services for seniors at the Belle Haven Community Campus.
Award of a construction contract for the 2025 Street Resurfacing project.

project_name: West Menlo Series Circuit Street Light Project
project_description: Authorization to execute an agreement with PG&E to replace high voltage circuits for the West Menlo Series Circuit Street Light project.

project_name: Belle Haven Child Development Center Electrification
project_description: Directive for staff to electrify the Belle Haven Child Development Center as part of the broader communitywide electrification program.
Plan to manage and advance the urban forest, identified as a City Council priority and supported by Environmental Justice Program Implementation Funds.
Ongoing municipal efforts and discussions regarding homelessness, including street outreach, RV safe parking, and coordination with service providers.
Discussion stemming from public opposition to the location of an Accessory Dwelling Unit, citing safety concerns and impact on redwood trees.
Discussion and award of a construction contract for the Middle Avenue Complete Streets project.

street_address: Coleman Avenue and Santa Monica Avenue
project_description: Pilot project authorizing parking removal and stop sign installation on Coleman Avenue to improve traffic and safety, scheduled for summer 2025 implementation.

project_name: 80 Willow Rd Mixed-Use Development Project EIR
project_description: Authorization for the City Manager to execute an agreement with LSA to prepare an Environmental Impact Report for a proposed mixed-use development project.

project_name: Fiscal Year 2025-26 Budget and Capital Improvement Plan
project_description: Public hearing and subsequent adoption of the fiscal year 2025-26 budget and Capital Improvement Plan, including funding allocations and priorities.
Resurfacing projects for Downtown Parking Lots Nos. 7 and 8, included in the Capital Improvement Plan.
Programs for traffic calming enhancements on local roads, discussed in the context of the Capital Improvement Plan and data-driven equity approach.
Project to design improvements needed to qualify for a quiet zone along the Caltrain railroad line, with ongoing discussions on funding and implementation.
Amendment of City Council Policy CC-01-1996 for the Community Funding Program, updating eligibility criteria, application process, and funding procedures.
Study session to review and provide guidance on draft development agreement terms for a project including up to 800 dwelling units and 1.1 million square feet of office/R&D buildings.

project_name: Habitat for Humanity Home Preservation Program Modifications
project_description: Review and consideration of modifications to the Home Preservation Program, including income eligibility and outreach, and authorization of a first amendment to the funding agreement.

project_name: Zero Emission Landscaping Equipment Ordinance (Zelli) Implementation
project_description: Update on the implementation of the zero emission landscaping equipment ordinance, a municipal initiative to reduce emissions.

project_name: El Camino Real and Ravenswood Avenue Crossing Improvement Project
street_address: El Camino Real and Ravenswood Avenue
project_description: Award of a construction contract for the El Camino Real and Ravenswood Avenue Crossing Improvement project.
Implementation of Menlo Park's first General Plan Environmental Justice (EJ) Element, focusing on community-identified priorities like safe homes, food access, and pollution reduction.
New City Council priority focused on enhancing downtown vibrancy, including discussions on a visioning process, commission formation, and events.

project_name: Minimum Lot Size Zoning Restrictions Review
project_description: Discussion of eliminating minimum lot size zoning restrictions to improve efficiency and staff time, identified as a priority under the housing umbrella.
Initiative discussed as a City Council priority to create and improve safe bike routes and bicycle infrastructure within the city.
Study to assess parking demand in Downtown Menlo Park, with a timeline update provided to the City Council.
Update on the City's comprehensive Five-Year Street Maintenance Plan, addressing resurfacing and other improvements across city streets.

project_name: Kelly Park Turf vs. Natural Grass
project_description: Consideration of installing natural grass instead of artificial turf at Kelly Park, prompted by delays in the Kelly Field replacement project.

project_name: Police Sergeants Association Labor Agreement Negotiations
project_description: Process of negotiating a successor labor agreement with the Menlo Park Police Sergeants' Association, including public input and closed session directives.
